title: Collection Specialist
job_overview:
******TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE, YOU MUST SUBMIT YOUR RESUME AND VIDEO INTRODUCTION.******

Job Type: Full-Time
Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Time, with a 1-hour unpaid break
Salary: $1200 per month

Job Overview:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and dependable Accounts Receivable/Data Entry and Collections Specialist to join our team. This role is responsible for accurately entering invoices, applying payments to customer accounts, managing customer accounts, and following up on outstanding payments to ensure timely collections. The ideal candidate will possess excellent time management skills, strong communication abilities, and a keen eye for accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:
AR/Data Entry:
Accurately enter, update, and maintain information in internal databases and systems

Invoice Entry
Verify and correct data to ensure completeness and accuracy
Organize and maintain electronic and paper filing systems
Payment Processing

Collections:
Contact customers via phone, email, or written correspondence regarding past due accounts
Monitor accounts receivable and identify overdue payments
Negotiate and establish payment arrangements in accordance with company policies
Document collection activity in system notes and escalate problematic accounts as needed
Collaborate with internal departments to resolve account discrepancies
Filing Preliminary Liens on projects per the direction of upper management.

Qualifications:
1â€“2 years of experience in data entry, collections, or a similar administrative role
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and Outlook), Sage and Point of Rental software experience a plus.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality
Knowledge of basic accounting or billing processes a plus
